tag.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: a small piece of paper, plastic etc attached to something to show what it is, who owns it, what it costs etc
tag.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: All the staff wore name tags.
tag.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: a children’s game in which one player chases and tries to touch the others
tag.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: a piece of equipment that you attach to an animal or person, especially someone who has just left prison, so that you always know where they are
tag.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: a computer code attached to a word or phrase in a computer document in order to arrange the data in a particular way
tag.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: a word or phrase which is used to describe a person, group, or thing, but which is often unfair or not correct
tag.translation[0].definitions[4].exampl: His speed earned him the tag of ‘the runner’.
tag.translation[0].definitions[6].defini: someone’s name that they paint illegally on a wall, vehicle etc
tag.translation[0].definitions[7].defini: the license plates on a car
tag.translation[0].definitions[8].defini: a small piece of sticky plastic with a date on it that you put on your car’s license plate to show that the car is legally allowed on the road in that year
tag.translation[0].note_box[0].sections[: Don’t forgot to remove the price tag.
Every baby had a name tag on his or her wrist.
Expensive items such as leather jackets have security tags which have to be removed at the till.
You can buy gift wrap with matching gift tags.
Was there a luggage tag on your suitcase?
tag.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: to attach a tag to something
tag.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: Each bird was tagged and released into the wild.
tag.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: to give someone or something a name or title, or describe them in a particular way
tag.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: The country no longer wants to be tagged as a Third World nation.
tag.translation[1].definitions[2].defini: to attach a tag in a computer program or document
tag.translation[1].definitions[2].exampl: All the words are tagged with their part of speech.
tag.translation[1].definitions[3].defini: to illegally paint your name on a wall, vehicle etc
tag.translation[1].definitions[4].defini: to touch someone you are chasing in a game, especially to touch someone with the ball in baseball
tag.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: a series of letters or words that are put before and after a piece of electronic text to show that it is to be treated in a particular way
